channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-14929] Cleanup usage of decodecomponent and use QueryStringDecoder from netty
item.description:
This is from the review of HADOOP-14910
There is also other place usage of decodeComponent(param(CreateFlagParam.NAME), StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
In ParameterParser.java Line 147-148:
String cf = decodeComponent(param(CreateFlagParam.NAME), StandardCharsets.UTF_8);

Use QueryStringDecoder from netty here too and cleanup the decodeComponent. Actually this is added for netty issue only.
item.summary: Cleanup usage of decodecomponent and use QueryStringDecoder from netty

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: will upload a patch once HADOOP-14910 gets committed.

Hi bharatviswa,

The original comment on the decodeComponent function said:

   * The following function behaves exactly the same as netty's
   * <code>QueryStringDecoder#decodeComponent</code> except that it
   * does not decode the '+' character as space. WebHDFS takes this scheme
   * to maintain the backward-compatibility for pre-2.7 releases.

I assume switching to the netty decoder does not introduce incompatibility because + is never expected in the CreateFlag?

arpitagarwal
1. This issue is already fixed in netty-code, now + is not converted to space.
2. createflag valid values are create, overwrite, append and sync_block. Even if user mistakenly passed "+", now it will not be an issue with decodeComponent method from netty.

Thanks bharatviswa. The patch LGTM.

Can you please add a couple of more test cases e.g. for

  1. createflag=create,overwrite
  2. createflag=

And maybe a couple of negative test cases for invalid flags, like:

  1. createflag=,
  2. createflag=create,

To make sure the behavior does not change.

Thank You arpitagarwal for review.
Attached patch v02 to address update test cases.
